com.orm.androrm
Class ForeignKeyField<T extends Model>

java.lang.Object
  com.orm.androrm.DataField<T>
      com.orm.androrm.ForeignKeyField<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of the linked model.
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatabaseField<T>, Relation<T>
public class ForeignKeyField<T extends Model>
extends DataField<T>
implements Relation<T>

The foreign key field can be used to build a relation between two models. One model can create a link to another model by using a foreign key. The type parameter is used to determine the linked model type.

Author:
Philipp Giese

Constructor Detail

ForeignKeyField

public ForeignKeyField(Class<T> target)
Initializes a new foreign key field. The target parameter is used to determine the class of the linked model in order to create the correct constraints.

Parameters:
target - Class of the linked model.
Method Detail

doNotCascade

public void doNotCascade()
By default foreign key fields have the option ON DELETE CASCADE set. This means if the model this field is pointing to will be deleted, also the referencing model will be deleted.

By calling doNotCascade on the field you can prevent this behavior.

getDefinition

public String getDefinition(String fieldName)
Description copied from interface: DatabaseField
Creates the database specific definition for this type of field.

Specified by:

getConstraint

public String getConstraint(String fieldName)
Creates the foreign key constraint for the database.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of the field, that references the other table.
Returns:
The constraint.

isPersisted

public boolean isPersisted()
This method can be called in order to determine, if the referenced model has already been persisted to the database.

Returns:
true if the model is present in the database, false otherwise.

getTarget

public Class<T> getTarget()
Description copied from interface: Relation
Retrieves the target class of this specific relation.

Specified by:
getTarget in interface Relation<T extends Model>
Returns:
The Class of the target model.

get

public T get(Context context)
As foreign keys may require database access in order to get their value, you have to use this function. The regular DataField.get() won't work at all times.

Parameters:
context - Context of the application.
Returns:
An instance of the references model or null if nothing could be found.

release

public void release()
When models are deleted you may wish to also release all references to other models on the instance in order to avoid unexpected behavior.

To do this on a foreign key, call this function.

set

public void set(int id)
As an alternative you don't have to hand in an instance of the model class, this field references. You can also only provide its id.

Parameters:
id - Model.PK of the referenced model.

set

public void set(Cursor c,
                int columnIndex)
Description copied from interface: DatabaseField
This method is used to read the value in the right format out of a Cursor. As only the implementing field knows the correct data type this responsibility is hence handed to it.

Specified by:
set in interface DatabaseField<T extends Model>
Parameters:
c - Cursor pointing at data.
columnIndex - Index of the field value in the cursor.

putData

public void putData(String key,
                    ContentValues values)
Description copied from interface: DatabaseField
When this field is serialized into the database this method is called. The field can then put it's data into the ContentValues variable under the given fieldName.

Specified by:
putData in interface DatabaseField<T extends Model>
Parameters:
key - Key for the ContentValues variable and also name of this field in the object, that is being serialized.
values - ContentValues object holding all data, that will be written to the database.
